description: Your comprehensive guide to Baldur's Gate 3 modifications, enhancing your gameplay experience with carefully curated mods.

categories.title: Categories
categories.prerequisites_desc: Essential tools and requirements for modding
categories.ui_desc: Enhance and customize the game interface
categories.gameplay_desc: Modify and improve core gameplay mechanics
categories.dice_desc: Modify dice rolling and random number generation

q1.question: How do I install mods for Baldur's Gate 3?
q1.answer: Most BG3 mods can be installed using mod managers like Vortex or BG3 Mod Manager. First, download the mod file, then use the manager to install and activate it. Some mods may require manual installation - always read the mod's documentation carefully.

1.q: Which mod manager should I choose?
1.a: For beginners, Vortex is recommended as it offers a user-friendly interface and integrates well with Nexus Mods. It features automatic downloads, easy installation, and conflict detection. BG3 Mod Manager (BG3MM) is preferred by advanced users for its powerful features like detailed load order control, mod profiles, and better handling of complex mod configurations. Both are actively maintained and support the latest game version.

2.q: How do I install mods manually?
2.a:
Manual installation involves several steps:

1. Locate your game's mod folder at 'Documents/Larian Studios/Baldur's Gate 3/Mods'
2. Extract the mod files from the downloaded archive
3. Copy the .pak files to the mods folder
4. Create or edit modsettings.lsx to set load order
5. Verify file permissions are correct

Note: Some mods may have additional files or specific installation requirements. Always check the mod's documentation for detailed instructions.

3.q: What's the correct load order for mods?
3.a:
The general rule for mod load order is:

1. Engine Fixes & Libraries (e.g., Native Mod Loader)
2. Script Extenders & Core Mods
3. Bug Fixes & Patches
4. Gameplay Overhauls
5. Class & Race Mods
6. Item & Equipment Mods
7. Visual & UI Mods
8. Compatibility Patches

Specific mods may have their own load order requirements. Check mod descriptions and use tools like BG3MM to detect and resolve load order conflicts.

q2.question: Are mods compatible with multiplayer?
q2.answer: Mod compatibility in multiplayer depends on several factors. Generally, all players need to have the same mods installed in the same order. UI and visual mods are usually safer for multiplayer than gameplay-changing mods.

1.q: How do I sync mods with friends?
1.a:
To ensure proper mod synchronization:

1. Create a shared mod list document
2. Include exact mod versions and download links
3. Agree on a specific load order
4. Use a mod manager to export/import profiles
5. Test connection with a small mod set first

Tools like BG3MM can export mod lists that others can import directly. Some mod managers also support automatic version checking.

2.q: Which mods are safe for multiplayer?
2.a:
Safe mods for multiplayer include:

• UI Enhancements (inventory sorting, better tooltips)
• Visual Improvements (textures, character appearances)
• Quality of Life Features (camera adjustments, hotkey changes)
• Performance Optimizations
• Shader/Graphics Tweaks

Avoid mods that:
• Change core gameplay mechanics
• Add new items or abilities
• Modify game balance
• Change quest or story content

3.q: What happens if mod versions don't match?
3.a:
Mismatched mod versions can cause:

1. Connection Failures: Game may fail to establish multiplayer connection
2. Desyncs: Players experience different game states
3. Crashes: Game may become unstable or crash
4. Save Corruption: Multiplayer saves might become corrupted

Always verify that all players have identical mod versions before starting a session. Use mod managers' version checking features when available.

q3.question: Will mods disable achievements?
q3.answer: By default, using mods will disable achievements in BG3. However, there are specific mods available that can re-enable achievements while using other mods.

1.a:
To re-enable achievements with mods:

1. Download an Achievement Enabler mod
2. Install it as a high-priority mod (early in load order)
3. Configure the mod according to its documentation
4. Test achievement tracking in-game

Popular options include:
• Achievement Enabler by LaughingLeader
• Native Achievement Unlocker
• Achievement Manager Plus

Note: These mods may need updating after game patches.

2.a:
Yes, by default any modification to the game files will disable achievements. This includes:

• Gameplay Mods
• Visual Mods
• UI Modifications
• Custom Content
• Script Changes

This is a built-in security feature to maintain achievement integrity. Even minor modifications like texture changes will trigger this protection.

3.a:
Achievement enabler mods are generally considered safe because:

1. They don't modify game content or mechanics
2. They only affect the achievement system
3. They're widely used and tested by the community
4. They don't impact save games or multiplayer

However, always download these mods from trusted sources and keep them updated with game patches.

q4.question: What should I do if a mod causes crashes?
q4.answer: First, verify the mod's compatibility with your game version. Try disabling the mod to confirm it's the source of the crash. Check for mod conflicts, and ensure you've installed all required dependencies.

1.q: How do I identify which mod is causing crashes?
1.a:
Follow these troubleshooting steps:

1. Disable all mods and test the game
2. Enable mods one at a time, testing after each
3. Check crash logs for specific error messages
4. Look for common patterns (when/where crashes occur)
5. Verify mod load order is correct

Use mod managers' built-in tools to help identify conflicts and issues. Keep a log of which mods were active when crashes occurred.

2.q: Where can I find crash logs?
2.a:
Crash logs can be found in several locations:

1. Main Location: 'Documents/Larian Studios/Baldur's Gate 3/Crash Reports'
2. Game Directory: '[Steam/GOG folder]/Baldur's Gate 3/Data/Logs'
3. Windows Event Viewer: Under 'Windows Logs > Application'

Important information in crash logs:
• Error codes and messages
• Active mods list
• System specifications
• Game version and settings

3.q: How do I report mod bugs?
3.a:
When reporting bugs to mod authors:

1. Provide Essential Information:
• Mod version
• Game version
• Complete mod list and load order
• Crash logs if applicable

2. Describe the Issue:
• Steps to reproduce
• Expected vs actual behavior
• Frequency of occurrence

3. Include Screenshots/Videos if relevant

4. Be patient and respectful - mod authors are volunteers!

4.q: Can game updates cause mod crashes?
4.a:
Yes, game updates can affect mods in several ways:

1. Direct Impacts:
• Changed game functions
• Modified file structures
• Updated scripting systems

2. Common Issues:
• Broken mod functionality
• Compatibility conflicts
• Performance problems

Always check mod pages after game updates and wait for mod authors to update their mods before continuing to use them.

q5.question: Can I use multiple mods together?
q5.answer: Yes, but you need to be careful about compatibility. Some mods may conflict with each other, especially if they modify the same game elements.

1.q: How many mods can I use at once?
1.a:
The number of mods you can use depends on several factors:

1. System Resources:
• Available RAM
• CPU processing power
• Storage space

2. Mod Types:
• Content mods (more resource-intensive)
• UI mods (generally lighter)
• Texture mods (affects VRAM)

3. Practical Limits:
• Most stable setups use 20-50 mods
• Complex mods count more than simple ones
• Consider load times and performance impact

2.q: How do I check mod compatibility?
2.a:
Check compatibility through these methods:

1. Read Mod Documentation:
• Known compatibility issues
• Required dependencies
• Recommended load order

2. Use Community Resources:
• Mod compatibility spreadsheets
• Forum discussions
• Discord channels

3. Test Systematically:
• Start with essential mods
• Add one mod at a time
• Document any issues

3.a:
Common types of mod conflicts include:

1. File Conflicts:
• Multiple mods editing same files
• Overlapping game systems
• Resource conflicts

2. Functionality Conflicts:
• Class/race modifications
• UI element changes
• Game mechanic alterations

3. Script Conflicts:
• Event timing issues
• Resource allocation conflicts
• Save/load conflicts

4.q: How do I resolve mod conflicts?
4.a:
Follow these steps to resolve conflicts:

1. Identify the Conflict:
• Use mod manager conflict detection
• Check error logs
• Test mods individually

2. Resolution Options:
• Adjust load order
• Find compatibility patches
• Choose alternative mods
• Contact mod authors

3. Prevention:
• Regular backup saves
• Document working configurations
• Stay informed about updates

q6.question: How do I update my mods?
q6.answer: Most mod managers will notify you of available updates. For manual installations, you'll need to check the mod page regularly.

1.q: Should I update all mods immediately?
1.a:
Consider these factors before updating:

1. Stability Concerns:
• Wait for user feedback
• Check for reported issues
• Verify compatibility

2. Update Priority:
• Critical bug fixes first
• Core functionality mods
• Optional features last

3. Best Practices:
• Backup saves before updating
• Update one mod at a time
• Test after each update

2.q: Do I need to start a new game after updates?
2.a:
The need for a new game depends on update type:

1. Safe to Continue:
• Visual updates
• UI modifications
• Minor bug fixes

2. New Game Recommended:
• Major gameplay changes
• New content additions
• Core system updates

3. Always Required:
• Save structure changes
• Core game updates
• Complete overhauls

3.q: How do I backup before updating?
3.a:
Create comprehensive backups following these steps:

1. Save Games:
• Copy 'PlayerProfiles' folder
• Archive specific character saves
• Backup save metadata

2. Mod Files:
• Export mod lists/profiles
• Backup mod configuration files
• Save current modsettings.lsx

3. Game Settings:
• Screenshot current configurations
• Note working mod combinations
• Document load orders

q7.question: Will mods affect my save games?
q7.answer: Some mods can affect save games, especially those that modify gameplay mechanics or add new content.

1.q: How do I backup save games?
1.a:
Follow this comprehensive backup process:

1. Locate Save Files:
• Main save folder: 'Documents/Larian Studios/Baldur's Gate 3/PlayerProfiles'
• Story saves: [Profile]/Savegames/Story
• Campaign saves: [Profile]/Savegames/Campaign

2. Backup Methods:
• Manual file copy to external drive
• Cloud storage sync
• Automated backup tools

3. Best Practices:
• Regular backups (daily/weekly)
• Version control for different mod setups
• Clear labeling system

2.a:
Removing mods mid-playthrough carries risks:

1. High-Risk Removals:
• Class/race mods
• Item mods with equipped gear
• Quest/story mods
• Character customization mods

2. Safer Removals:
• UI modifications
• Visual enhancements
• Sound mods
• Performance tweaks

3. Safety Measures:
• Always backup saves first
• Test on a separate save
• Document removed mods

3.q: How do I fix corrupted saves?
3.a:
When dealing with corrupted saves:

1. Immediate Actions:
• Don't overwrite existing saves
• Check crash logs for causes
• Verify game file integrity

2. Recovery Options:
• Load earlier save backup
• Use save repair tools
• Remove problematic mods

3. Prevention:
• Regular save backups
• Test new mods on separate saves
• Monitor mod compatibility

4.q: Which mods are safe to add mid-game?
4.a:
Safe mods to add during a playthrough:

1. Visual Mods:
• Texture improvements
• Character appearances
• Environmental effects

2. Interface Mods:
• UI enhancements
• Information displays
• Control modifications

3. Quality of Life:
• Camera adjustments
• Performance optimizations
• Sound enhancements

Always test new mods on a backup save first!

q8.question: What do I do if my game won't start after installing mods?
q8.answer: Try verifying your game files through Steam/GOG, disable all mods and re-enable them one by one to identify the problematic mod.

1.q: How do I verify game files?
1.a:
Follow these steps to verify game files:

1. Steam Method:
• Right-click BG3 in library
• Properties > Local Files
• 'Verify integrity of game files'

2. GOG Method:
• Select BG3 in library
• More > Manage Installation
• 'Verify/Repair'

3. After Verification:
• Restart your computer
• Launch game without mods
• Gradually re-enable mods

2.q: How do I start in safe mode?
2.a:
To start the game in safe mode:

1. Disable Mods:
• Rename/move mods folder
• Backup modsettings.lsx
• Clear shader cache

2. Launch Options:
• Use '--skip-launcher' parameter
• Launch directly from game folder
• Use 'verify' command line option

3. Troubleshooting:
• Check game logs
• Monitor system resources
• Test different DirectX versions

3.q: What files should I delete if game won't start?
3.a:
Consider cleaning these files/folders:

1. Safe to Delete:
• Shader cache folder
• Temporary files
• DirectX shader cache
• Graphics settings file

2. Never Delete:
• Save games
• Character profiles
• Custom content
• Game installation files

3. After Cleaning:
• Verify game files
• Reset graphics settings
• Test without mods

history.title: Baldur's Gate Legacy & Modding
history.bg_content: The Baldur's Gate series has been a cornerstone of computer RPGs since 1998. The original games, developed by BioWare, set new standards for storytelling and tactical combat in video games. The series is based on Dungeons & Dragons rules and the Forgotten Realms campaign setting, featuring rich character development, complex narratives, and strategic combat systems.
history.bg3_content:
Baldur's Gate 3, developed by Larian Studios, brings the beloved franchise into modern gaming with stunning visuals, deep gameplay mechanics, and unprecedented player choice. The game features turn-based combat based on D&D 5th Edition rules, extensive character customization, multiplayer capabilities, and a rich, branching narrative. Key features include:

• Authentic D&D 5e ruleset implementation
• Dynamic, turn-based combat system
• Extensive character creation and customization
• Multi-layered storylines with meaningful choices
• Advanced graphics and physics engine
• Cross-platform multiplayer support
• Robust modding capabilities
history.modding_content:
Baldur's Gate 3's modding community has created thousands of modifications that enhance and expand the game in countless ways. From subtle tweaks to major overhauls, mods allow players to customize their experience to match their preferred playstyle. Popular mod categories include:

• Gameplay enhancements and rebalancing
• New classes, subclasses, and spells
• Character appearance options
• UI improvements and quality of life features
• Equipment and item modifications
• Custom campaigns and quests
• Performance optimizations
• Graphical enhancements
history.modding_features:
Key modding features supported by BG3 include:

• Custom content creation
• Script modifications
• UI customization
• Model and texture replacements
• Sound and music additions
• Gameplay mechanic adjustments
• New item integration
• Character customization options
history.modding_community:
The BG3 modding community continues to grow and innovate, creating new tools and resources for mod development. Notable achievements include:

• Advanced mod management tools
• Collaborative modding projects
• Documentation and tutorials
• Regular mod updates and maintenance
• Cross-mod compatibility solutions
• Performance optimization techniques
• Bug fixing and stability improvements

no_mods_in_category: No mods found in this category yet.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: Our mission is to provide a comprehensive and user-friendly platform for Baldur's Gate 3 mod enthusiasts. We strive to make mod discovery, installation, and management as seamless as possible, while fostering a vibrant community of modders and players.

story.title: Our Story
story.content:
It all began during my first playthrough of Baldur's Gate 3. As a long-time RPG enthusiast, I was immediately captivated by the game's depth and possibilities. However, it was the modding community that truly opened my eyes to the game's incredible potential.

Like many newcomers to BG3 modding, my journey started with a simple desire: I wanted to customize my character's appearance. What seemed like a straightforward task quickly turned into an adventure of its own. I spent hours browsing through hundreds of mods, reading compatibility notes, and trying to understand load orders. My first attempt at installing mods resulted in my character wearing a bucket for a head – not quite the heroic look I was aiming for!

The challenges didn't stop there. One memorable incident involved installing what I thought was a simple camp expansion mod. Instead, I accidentally installed a mod that turned all the camp's inhabitants into dancing goblins. While hilarious, it wasn't exactly conducive to the serious roleplaying experience I was seeking. Another time, I managed to install a mod that was supposed to enhance spell effects, only to find that every magic missile I cast turned into a shower of colorful rubber ducks.

These mishaps, while amusing, highlighted a serious issue: the BG3 modding scene, while incredibly rich and diverse, could be overwhelming for newcomers. I found myself maintaining spreadsheets to track mod compatibility, creating detailed installation guides for friends, and spending more time helping others troubleshoot their mod setups than actually playing the game.

That's when the idea struck me. What if there was a platform that could make the modding experience more accessible? A place where newcomers could easily find, understand, and install mods without going through the same trials and errors I did? A hub that could guide players through their modding journey, from their first character customization to advanced gameplay overhauls?

This website is the result of that vision. Built by a modding enthusiast for modding enthusiasts, it aims to bridge the gap between the amazing content created by our talented modding community and players who want to enhance their BG3 experience. Every feature, every category, and every guide on this site comes from real experiences – both the successes and the amusing failures.

The site's design reflects the lessons learned from countless hours of modding adventures. We've organized mods into intuitive categories, provided clear compatibility information, and created step-by-step installation guides. Our goal is to ensure that no new player has to accidentally turn their character into a tap-dancing goblin (unless, of course, that's what they're going for!).

As the BG3 modding community continues to grow and create incredible content, we're committed to evolving alongside it. This platform is more than just a mod database – it's a testament to the creativity, humor, and dedication of the modding community, and a helping hand to those just beginning their modding journey.

So whether you're looking to enhance your graphics, overhaul gameplay mechanics, or simply want to ensure your character's head stays firmly attached to their shoulders, we're here to help. Welcome to your friendly guide to the wonderful world of BG3 modding!
